pZzVMInluL9pFVf5MpR56g.text: Was basically in a food coma after this visit. Grub was amazing and plentiful. Had to cycle home after my feed and as I had stuffed myself to the brim it was a trying affair.   Highly recommend. Nom nom nom. Everything tasted so good. Service was fast, servers were really accommodating.

7wBofqWf78Em3RdOHkQukA.text: Sadly, this place is not vegetarian friendly.  They grill everything on one grill - vegetables, bread and meat.  The bread we were served tonight  had pieces of meat in it. When I told the waitress she said  "yes, we soak it in meat. You didn't tell me you were vegetarian."  Ordering only vegetarian dishes is not a clue to tell diners that the bread has chunks of meat in it?  What kind of restaurant serves meat bread and doesn't label it ?!  Don't go here.

3YcZKTuwvUrLsj6przLzcg.text: This place is a great find if you enjoy delicious Mediterranean food! I ordered the chicken wings and the mezze. I didn't enjoy the vine leaves, but I had never had them before so I didn't have anything to compare it too. The hummus and kebab was absolutely delicious though and they brought out warm fresh bread to dip with. I would go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Verdo Turkish Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

gR2Qdgl-8Dymjrbz8EKPqw.text: Unfortunate... we stopped here because the nearby highly rated restaurant was not open yet and we were starving.   We ordered the iskinder kabob and something else that was basically chicken on a bed of eggplant. Maybe it was that we were American, they gave us two little mezzes and a salad on the house. But it just didn't make up for the completely underwhelming flavors of both dishes. The iskender was basically kobida with a poor attempt at a tomato sauce. If you like the taste of burned food this is it.

fz_FHdN6gSs3GQPP7LAJxw.text: I came here for a two course lunch which was excellent value and heaps of food. We opted to share the chicken wings and mixed meze as our starters and they were.... Ok. The bread was delicious but the rest didn't thrill me.  We all enjoyed our mains but again weren't overwhelmed.  The service was very very good though so I'm willing to accept that my a-ok experience could have just been a poor representation of the restaurant as a whole.

MAwQKFJIItREeRrpUKhOHw.text: Could smell the scrumptious Mediterranean BBQ all the way down the street.  Good service, great food, so glad we followed our noses!

hDJ-oHlk9v4mrpFZZIkoAg.text: I come for a Business Stop to Edinburgh. At saturday night there are 3 tables free in the Location but they told me hey will reserved the tables for more than one people. Sorry, big fail for a Restaurant.

4GxNQfI4KE6az-8MZwc2yg.text: I definitely gave this restaurant 5 stars. For the very yummy food, friendly service and cheap price! It's the best Turkish restaurant I have tried in Edinburgh. All the food is of great quality.

gvkeB8OtYzW7Ljzh7ocfnw.text: Wonderful welcoming small restaurant near Pollack Halls of Residence. We stopped in for some take away and were treated to hot Turkish tea while we watched our sis kebab being prepared over the open charcoal brazier. The mixed mezza platter was delicious and plentiful, the felafel crisp and well spiced, and the three additional containers of sauces, charred onions and mushrooms, and sauteed onions plus were icing on the cake. And they made sure we took some Turkish Delight as we left.
